subject: Re: FW: Poultry HQ: WooCommerce + Xero Intregration

full_threads.body:
Hi Haris,

Got it, we have updated the zapier integration to point all the orders to Woocommerce Contact and we have updated manually the draft invoices and set the contact to Woocommerce Contact (Draft Invoices).

Hi,

This is creating a messy outcome in our Xero system.

Id prefer it was collated in one "customer'.

Haris
moutzouris Managing director

phone

(03) 5926 0729

website

http://www.poultryhq.com.au/

address

Building 2, 109-111 Craig Rd, Devon Meadows, Vic, 3977

Hi Haris,

Thanks for sending through the screenshot.

The setup you're seeing is from a previous integration using Amaka, which creates a single contact in Xero and attaches all invoices to it. However, the issue with this method is that invoices are automatically marked as paid, which doesn't align with your current requirements. Woocommerce contact

To address this, we’ve implemented a new setup using Zapier. Now, whenever an order is completed in WooCommerce, a corresponding invoice is automatically created in Xero with draft status ([link to Draft invoices]). We've also configured it so that each new contact in Xero is created based on the email address from the WooCommerce order, ensuring proper record keeping and flexibility.

Hi,

Nothing has changed please see screen shot of WooCommerce account on Xero where all shop online invoices should be.

Also I have attached a screen shot of the WooCommerce customers that Xero created individual accounts for.

Hi Haris,

It looks like you were referring to the duplicate contacts in Xero, which were caused by the order import we performed earlier today.

We’ve gone ahead and removed those duplicates and reassigned the invoices to the correct, existing contacts.

To prevent this from happening again, we’ve updated the Zapier integration with a condition: if the email or customer already exists in Xero, the invoice will now be assigned to that existing contact rather than creating a new one.

Everything should be in order now, but please let us know if you notice anything else.

I'm not in office
Orders coming through the integration are not coming into the customer as WooCommerce with all previous orders they are being imported as their own customer using a name or an

Kind Regards,
Haris Moutzouris

P: (03) 5926 0729
A: Build2 109-111 Craig Road,
Devon Meadows, Vic, 3978

Hi Haris.

Could you please send a screenshot of what you’re referring to? That will help us clearly understand the issue and ensure we’re fixing the correct feature?

Thanks!

Thanks!

Cc: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Re: FW: Poultry HQ: WooCommerce + Xero Intregration


Hi Haris.


We've looked into this, and it appears that the payment status is being determined based on WooCommerce, not when Stripe actually receives the payment. Since the customer used Stripe, WooCommerce marked the status as "Paid," which in turn caused Xero to also record it as "Paid."

As for syncing the orders to Xero, it seems we may need to do this manually for now. However, we're still exploring free plugin options that could automate the process and save time.

We'll keep you updated on our progress.

Thank you!

Hi Haris.


After reviewing the Amaka integration, we noted that three syncs have been successful so far. However, the latest order placed on June 13 has not yet synced to Xero.

We're currently operating under the assumption that syncing only occurs for completed orders. This can likely be confirmed once the order is marked as completed. Since the delivery date is set for June 19, we'll continue monitoring to see if it syncs after that point.

If this integration does not meet our needs, we may consider switching to a Zapier integration, which offers more advanced setup options. Please note that Zapier is a paid solution, and we wanted to give you a heads-up about that potential cost.

Additionally, could you please confirm whether you'd like us to sync previous orders to Xero, or if the integration should only apply to new orders moving forward?

In the meantime, we'll continue to monitor the current sync setup this week and will keep you updated.

Hi Haris.


We're currently in the process of integrating Xero with your WooCommerce store. As part of this setup, we've created a temporary account under our email using Amaka - the third-party tool that facilitates the connection between the two platforms.

To proceed, we need access to your Xero account to complete the integration. Are you able to provide your Xero login credentials for this purpose?

If you prefer not to share your login details, no problem - we can instead provide you with the Amaka account credentials along with a step-by-step guide so you can connect your Xero account directly.

Please let us know how you'd like to proceed.

--


Cindy Valderama
